syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: use the expansion of (a + b)ⁿ, where n is a positive integer
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including the notations (n r) and n! Knowledge of the greatest term and properties of the coefficients are not required.

learning_objectives.description: use the formulae for the nth term and for the sum of the first n terms to solve problems involving arithmetic or geometric progressions
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including knowledge that numbers a, b, c are 'in arithmetic progression' if 2b = a + c (or equivalent) and are 'in geometric progression' if b² = ac (or equivalent). Questions may involve more than one progression.

learning_objectives.description: use the condition for the convergence of a geometric progression, and the formula for the sum to infinity of a convergent geometric progression.
